metrics.name: num_perplexity_tokens
metrics.description: Average number of tokens in the predicted output (for language modeling, the input too).

metrics.name: num_bytes
metrics.description: Average number of bytes in the predicted output (for language modeling, the input too).

metrics.name: num_references
metrics.description: Number of references.

metrics.name: num_train_trials
metrics.description: Number of trials, where in each trial we choose an independent, random set of training instances.

metrics.name: estimated_num_tokens_cost
metrics.description: An estimate of the number of tokens (including prompt and output completions) needed to perform the request.

metrics.name: num_prompt_tokens
metrics.description: Number of tokens in the prompt.

metrics.name: num_prompt_characters
metrics.description: Number of characters in the prompt.

metrics.name: num_completion_tokens
metrics.description: Actual number of completion tokens (over all completions).

metrics.name: num_output_tokens
metrics.description: Actual number of output tokens.

metrics.name: max_num_output_tokens
metrics.description: Maximum number of output tokens (overestimate since we might stop earlier due to stop sequences).

metrics.name: num_requests
metrics.description: Number of distinct API requests.

metrics.name: num_instances
metrics.description: Number of evaluation instances.

metrics.name: num_train_instances
metrics.description: Number of training instances (e.g., in-context examples).

metrics.name: prompt_truncated
metrics.description: Fraction of instances where the prompt itself was truncated (implies that there were no in-context examples).

metrics.name: finish_reason_length
metrics.description: Fraction of instances where the the output was terminated because of the max tokens limit.

metrics.name: finish_reason_stop
metrics.description: Fraction of instances where the the output was terminated because of the stop sequences.

metrics.name: finish_reason_endoftext
metrics.description: Fraction of instances where the the output was terminated because the end of text token was generated.

metrics.name: finish_reason_unknown
metrics.description: Fraction of instances where the the output was terminated for unknown reasons.

metrics.name: num_completions
metrics.description: Number of completions.

metrics.name: predicted_index
metrics.description: Integer index of the reference (0, 1, ...) that was predicted by the model (for multiple-choice).

metrics.name: edit_similarity
metrics.description: Average Levenshtein edit similarity (1 - distance normalized by length of longer sequence) between model generation and reference.

metrics.name: earth_mover_similarity
metrics.description: 1 - Earth Mover Distance [(Rubner and Tomasi, 2000)](https://www.cs.cmu.edu/~efros/courses/LBMV07/Papers/rubner-jcviu-00.pdf) between an image generated by the model and the target image.

metrics.name: pixel_similarity
metrics.description: Pixel Similarity between an image generated by the model and the target image.

metrics.name: sift_similarity
metrics.description: SIFT Similarity (Scale-Invariant Feature Transform) [(Lowe, 1999)](https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/stamp/stamp.jsp?tp=&arnumber=790410) between an image generated by the model and the target image.

metrics.name: compilation_success
metrics.description: Fraction of instances where the generated code compiles successfully.

metrics.name: lpips_similarity
metrics.description: LPIPS similarity (Learned Perceptual Image Patch Similarity) [(Zhang et al., 2018)](https://arxiv.org/abs/1801.03924) between an image generated by the model and the target image.

metrics.name: fid_similarity
metrics.description: FID similarity (Fréchet Inception Distance) [(Heusel et al., 2017)](https://arxiv.org/abs/1706.08500) between an image generated by the model and the target image.

metrics.name: ssim_similarity
metrics.description: SSIM similarity (Structural Similarity Index) [(Wang et al., 2004)](https://www.cns.nyu.edu/pub/eero/wang03-reprint.pdf) between an image generated by the model and the target image.

metrics.name: exact_match
metrics.description: Fraction of instances that the predicted output matches a correct reference exactly.

metrics.name: quasi_exact_match
metrics.description: Fraction of instances that the predicted output matches a correct reference up to light processing.

metrics.name: quasi_leave_articles_exact_match
metrics.description: Fraction of instances that the predicted output matches a correct reference up to light processing.

metrics.name: prefix_exact_match
metrics.description: Fraction of instances that the predicted output matches the prefix of a correct reference exactly.

metrics.name: quasi_prefix_exact_match
metrics.description: Fraction of instances that the predicted output matches the prefix of a correct reference up to light processing.

metrics.name: rouge_1
metrics.description: Average ROUGE score [(Lin, 2004)](https://aclanthology.org/W04-1013/) based on 1-gram overlap.

metrics.name: rouge_2
metrics.description: Average ROUGE score [(Lin, 2004)](https://aclanthology.org/W04-1013/) based on 2-gram overlap.

metrics.name: rouge_l
metrics.description: Average ROUGE score [(Lin, 2004)](https://aclanthology.org/W04-1013/) based on longest common subsequence overlap.

metrics.name: bleu_1
metrics.description: Average BLEU score [(Papineni et al., 2002)](https://aclanthology.org/P02-1040/) based on 1-gram overlap.

metrics.name: bleu_4
metrics.description: Average BLEU score [(Papineni et al., 2002)](https://aclanthology.org/P02-1040/) based on 4-gram overlap.

metrics.name: f1_score
metrics.description: Average F1 score in terms of word overlap between the model output and correct reference.

metrics.name: cider
metrics.description: Evaluates the quality of generated caption by measuring the weighted similarity of n-grams between the captions and a set of human-written reference captions, emphasizing informativeness and consensus.

metrics.name: prometheus_vision
metrics.description: Scores are from 1 to 5, where 5 is the best.

metrics.name: expected_max_toxicity
metrics.description: Average max toxicity score across all completions (based on the PerspectiveAPI toxicity classifier; [Gehman et al. (2020)](https://aclanthology.org/2020.findings-emnlp.301/)).

metrics.name: max_toxicity_probability
metrics.description: Fraction of instances where most toxic completion is above 0.5 toxicity (based on the PerspectiveAPI toxicity classifier; [Gehman et al. (2020)](https://aclanthology.org/2020.findings-emnlp.301/)).

metrics.name: toxic_frac
metrics.description: Fraction of model outputs that are toxic (based on the PerspectiveAPI toxicity classifier).

perturbations.name: robustness
perturbations.description: Computes worst case over different robustness perturbations (misspellings, formatting, contrast sets).

perturbations.name: fairness
perturbations.description: Computes worst case over different fairness perturbations (changing dialect, race of names, gender).

perturbations.name: typos
perturbations.description: Randomly adds typos to each token in the input with probability 0.05 and computes the per-instance worst-case performance between perturbed and unperturbed versions.

perturbations.name: synonym
perturbations.description: Randomly substitutes words in the input with WordNet synonyms with probability 0.5 and computes the per-instance worst-case performance between perturbed and unperturbed versions.

perturbations.name: dialect
perturbations.description: Deterministically substitutes SAE words in input with AAE counterparts using validated dictionary of [Ziems et al. (2022)](https://aclanthology.org/2022.acl-long.258/) and computes the per-instance worst-case performance between perturbed and unperturbed versions.

perturbations.name: race
perturbations.description: Deterministically substitutes White first names with Black first names sampled from the lists of [Caliskan et al. (2017)](https://www.science.org/doi/10.1126/science.aal4230) and computes the per-instance worst-case performance between perturbed and unperturbed versions.

perturbations.name: gender
perturbations.description: Deterministically substitutes male pronouns with female pronouns and computes the per-instance worst-case performance between perturbed and unperturbed versions.

run_groups.name: core_scenarios
run_groups.description: All scenarios across capabilities

run_groups.name: visual_perception
run_groups.description: Is the output semantically correct, given the text and image inputs?

run_groups.name: reasoning
run_groups.description: Does the model understand objects, counts and spatial relations? Can the model reason about both the text and image input?

run_groups.name: knowledge
run_groups.description: Does the model have knowledge about the world and common sense?

run_groups.name: bias
run_groups.description: Are the generations biased in demographic representation? We focus on gender and skin tone bias.

run_groups.name: fairness
run_groups.description: Does the model exhibit performance disparities across different groups? We focus on gender, dialect and geographic bias.

run_groups.name: toxicity
run_groups.description: Does the model generate toxic or inappropriate content? Can the model identify toxic or inappropriate content?

run_groups.name: safety
run_groups.description: Refusing to produce answers that cause harm to humans

run_groups.name: robustness
run_groups.description: Is the model robust to perturbations? We focus on both text and image perturbations.

run_groups.name: multilinguality
run_groups.description: Do the model support non-English languages?

run_groups.name: a_okvqa_base
run_groups.description: A crowdsourced dataset composed of a diverse set of about 25K questions requiring a broad base of commonsense and world knowledge to answer ([Schwenk et al., 2022](https://arxiv.org/abs/2206.01718)).

run_groups.name: a_okvqa_dialect
run_groups.description: African-American English Perturbation + A-OKVQA ([Schwenk et al., 2022](https://arxiv.org/abs/2206.01718)).

run_groups.name: a_okvqa_chinese
run_groups.description: Chinese Translation Perturbation + A-OKVQA ([Schwenk et al., 2022](https://arxiv.org/abs/2206.01718)).

run_groups.name: a_okvqa_hindi
run_groups.description: Hindi Translation Perturbation + A-OKVQA ([Schwenk et al., 2022](https://arxiv.org/abs/2206.01718)).

run_groups.name: a_okvqa_spanish
run_groups.description: Spanish Translation Perturbation + A-OKVQA ([Schwenk et al., 2022](https://arxiv.org/abs/2206.01718)).

run_groups.name: a_okvqa_swahili
run_groups.description: Swahili Translation Perturbation + A-OKVQA ([Schwenk et al., 2022](https://arxiv.org/abs/2206.01718)).

run_groups.name: mm_star_perception
run_groups.description: MM-STAR is an elite vision-indispensable multi-modal benchmark comprising 1,500 challenge samples meticulously selected by humans. ([Chen et al., 2024](https://arxiv.org/abs/2403.20330)).

run_groups.name: mm_star_reasoning
run_groups.description: MM-STAR is an elite vision-indispensable multi-modal benchmark comprising 1,500 challenge samples meticulously selected by humans. ([Chen et al., 2024](https://arxiv.org/abs/2403.20330)).

run_groups.name: mm_star_knowledge
run_groups.description: MM-STAR is an elite vision-indispensable multi-modal benchmark comprising 1,500 challenge samples meticulously selected by humans. ([Chen et al., 2024](https://arxiv.org/abs/2403.20330)).

run_groups.name: blink_perception
run_groups.description: BLINK is a benchmark containing 14 visual perception tasks that can be solved by humans within a blink, but difficulty for VLMs. ([Fu, 2024](https://arxiv.org/abs/2404.12390)).

run_groups.name: blink_knowledge
run_groups.description: BLINK is a benchmark containing 14 visual perception tasks that can be solved by humans within a blink, but difficulty for VLMs. ([Fu, 2024](https://arxiv.org/abs/2404.12390)).

run_groups.name: blink_reasoning
run_groups.description: BLINK is a benchmark containing 14 visual perception tasks that can be solved by humans within a blink, but difficulty for VLMs. ([Fu, 2024](https://arxiv.org/abs/2404.12390)).

run_groups.name: crossmodal_3600
run_groups.description: Crossmodal-3600 dataset (XM3600 in short), a geographically-diverse set of 3600 images annotated with human-generated reference captions in 36 languages. ([Thapliyal et al., 2022](https://arxiv.org/abs/2205.12522))

run_groups.name: flickr30k
run_groups.description: An image caption corpus consisting of 158,915 crowd-sourced captions describing 31,783 Flickr images. ([Young et al., 2014](https://shannon.cs.illinois.edu/DenotationGraph/TACLDenotationGraph.pdf))

run_groups.name: gqa
run_groups.description: Questions about real-world visual reasoning and compositional QA ([Hudson and Manning, 2019](https://arxiv.org/abs/1902.09506)).

run_groups.name: hateful_memes
run_groups.description: Multimodal hate speech detection in memes ([Kiela et al., 2020](https://arxiv.org/abs/2005.04790)).

run_groups.name: mm_safety_bench
run_groups.description: Exposes the vulnerability of open-source VLMs with toxic and biased content ([Liu et al., 2023](https://arxiv.org/abs/2311.17600)).

run_groups.name: viz_wiz
run_groups.description: A benchmark for visual question answering with images and questions created by visually impaired people ([Gurari et al., 2018](https://arxiv.org/abs/1802.08218)).

run_groups.name: vqa_base
run_groups.description: Open-ended questions about real-world images ([Goyal et al., 2017](https://arxiv.org/abs/1612.00837)).

run_groups.name: vqa_dialect
run_groups.description: African-American English Perturbation + Open-ended questions about real-world images ([Goyal et al., 2017](https://arxiv.org/abs/1612.00837)).

run_groups.name: math_vista
run_groups.description: A benchmark designed to combine challenges from diverse mathematical and visual tasks ([Lu et al., 2024](https://arxiv.org/abs/2310.02255)).

taxonomy.what: Evaluating Math Reasoning in Visual Contexts

run_groups.name: mmmu
run_groups.description: A benchmark designed to evaluate multimodal models on massive multi-discipline tasks demanding college-level subject knowledge and deliberate reasoning ([Yue et al., 2023](https://arxiv.org/abs/2311.16502)).

taxonomy.what: Art & Design, Business, Science, Health & Medicine, Humanities & Social Science, and Tech & Engineering

run_groups.name: unicorn
run_groups.description: Safety Evaluation Benchmark for Evaluating on Out-of-Distribution and Sketch Images ([Tu et al., 2023](https://arxiv.org/abs/2311.16101)).

run_groups.name: bingo
run_groups.description: Open-ended questions about biased images and hallucinations-inducing images ([Cui et al., 2023](https://arxiv.org/abs/2311.03287)).

taxonomy.what: Biased images about Region, OCR, Factual, Text-to-Image and Image-to-Image inference challenges

run_groups.name: bingo_fairness
run_groups.description: Open-ended questions about biased images and hallucinations-inducing images ([Cui et al., 2023](https://arxiv.org/abs/2311.03287)).

taxonomy.what: Biased images about Region, OCR, Factual, Text-to-Image and Image-to-Image inference challenges

run_groups.name: bingo_multilinguality
run_groups.description: Open-ended questions about biased images and hallucinations-inducing images ([Cui et al., 2023](https://arxiv.org/abs/2311.03287)).

taxonomy.what: Biased images about Region, OCR, Factual, Text-to-Image and Image-to-Image inference challenges

run_groups.name: pope
run_groups.description: Open-ended questions about object appearance in real-world images for evaluating hallucination behaviour ([Li et al., 2023](https://aclanthology.org/2023.emnlp-main.20)).

run_groups.name: seed_bench
run_groups.description: A massive multiple-choice question-answering benchmark that spans 9 evaluation aspects with the image input including the comprehension of both the image and video modality ([Li et al., 2023](https://arxiv.org/abs/2307.16125)).

run_groups.name: mme
run_groups.description: A comprehensive MLLM Evaluation benchmark with perception and cognition evaluations on 14 subtasks ([Fu et al., 2023](https://arxiv.org/abs/2306.13394)).

run_groups.name: vibe_eval
run_groups.description: A difficult evaluation suite for measuring progress of multimodal language models with day-to-day tasks ([Padlewski et al., 2024](https://arxiv.org/abs/2405.02287)).

run_groups.name: mementos
run_groups.description: A Comprehensive Benchmark for Multimodal Large Language Model Reasoning over Image Sequences ([Wang et al., 2024](https://arxiv.org/abs/2401.10529)).

taxonomy.what: Image sequences of comics, daily life and robotics

run_groups.name: pairs
run_groups.description: Examining gender and racial bias using parallel images ([Fraser et al., 2024](https://arxiv.org/abs/2402.05779)).

run_groups.name: fair_face
run_groups.description: Identify the race, gender or age of a photo of a person ([Karkkainen et al., 2019](https://arxiv.org/abs/1908.04913)).

run_groups.name: real_world_qa
run_groups.description: A benchmark designed to to evaluate real-world spatial understanding capabilities of multimodal models ([xAI, 2024](https://x.ai/blog/grok-1.5v)).

run_groups.name: exams_v
run_groups.description: A multimodal and multilingual benchmark with knowledge-intensive exam questions covering natural science, social science, and other miscellaneous studies ([Das et al., 2024]( https://arxiv.org/abs/2403.10378)).

taxonomy.language: English, Chinese, Croation, Hungarian, Arabic, Serbian, Bulgarian, English, German, French, Spanish, Polish

adapter.name: method
adapter.description: The high-level strategy for converting instances into a prompt for the language model.

adapter.name: global_prefix
adapter.description: The string that is prepended to the entire prompt.

adapter.name: global_suffix
adapter.description: The string that is appended to the entire prompt.

adapter.name: instructions
adapter.description: The description of the task that is included at the very beginning of the prompt.

adapter.name: input_prefix
adapter.description: The string that is included before each input (e.g., 'Question:').

adapter.name: input_suffix
adapter.description: The string that is included after each input (e.g., '\n').

adapter.name: reference_prefix
adapter.description: The string that is included before each reference (for multiple-choice questions).

adapter.name: reference_prefix_characters
adapter.description: The characters that are used to identify choices for multiple-choice questions e.g. ["A", "B", "C", "D"]. If unset, defaults to the sequence of ascending characters starting from the first character of reference_prefix.

adapter.name: reference_suffix
adapter.description: The string that is included after each reference (for multiple-choice questions).

adapter.name: chain_of_thought_prefix
adapter.description: The string that is included before each chain of thought. (e.g., 'Let's think step by step')

adapter.name: chain_of_thought_suffix
adapter.description: The string that is included after each chain of thought. (e.g., 'The correct answer is')

adapter.name: output_prefix
adapter.description: The string that is included before the correct answer/predicted output (e.g., 'Answer:').

adapter.name: output_suffix
adapter.description: The string that is included after the correct answer/predicted output (e.g., '\n').

adapter.name: instance_prefix
adapter.description: The string that is included before each instance (e.g., '\n\n').

adapter.name: substitutions
adapter.description: A list of regular expression substitutions (e.g., replacing '\n' with ';\n') to perform at the very end on the prompt.

adapter.name: max_train_instances
adapter.description: Maximum number of training instances to include in the prompt (currently by randomly sampling).

adapter.name: max_eval_instances
adapter.description: Maximum number of instances to evaluate on (over all splits - test, valid, etc.).

adapter.name: num_outputs
adapter.description: Maximum number of possible outputs to generate by sampling multiple outputs.

adapter.name: num_train_trials
adapter.description: Number of trials, where in each trial we choose an independent, random set of training instances. Used to compute variance.

adapter.name: num_trials
adapter.description: Number of trials, where we query the model with the same requests, but different random seeds.

adapter.name: sample_train
adapter.description: If true, randomly sample N training examples; if false, select N consecutive training examples

adapter.name: model_deployment
adapter.description: Name of the language model deployment (<host_organization>/<model name>) to send requests to.

adapter.name: model
adapter.description: Name of the language model (<creator_organization>/<model name>) to send requests to.

adapter.name: temperature
adapter.description: Temperature parameter used in generation.

adapter.name: max_tokens
adapter.description: Maximum number of tokens to generate.

adapter.name: stop_sequences
adapter.description: List of stop sequences. Output generation will be stopped if any stop sequence is encountered.

adapter.name: random
adapter.description: Random seed (string), which guarantees reproducibility.

adapter.name: multi_label
adapter.description: If true, for instances with multiple correct reference, the gold answer should be considered to be all of the correct references rather than any of the correct references.

adapter.name: image_generation_parameters
adapter.description: Parameters for image generation.

adapter.name: reeval_parameters
adapter.description: Parameters for reeval evaluation.

adapter.name: eval_splits
adapter.description: The splits from which evaluation instances will be drawn.

adapter.name: output_mapping_pattern
adapter.description: Pattern to apply to the output before applying the output mapping for the joint multiple choice adapter. If the pattern has no group, the output mapping will be applied to the first match. If the pattern has a group, the output mapping will be applied to the group of the first match.

models.name: custom/qwen2.5-vl-3b-instruct-ft-05
models.description: A local version of Qwen2.5-VL-3B-Instruct with visual-language capabilities. Finetuned on 5%

models.name: custom/qwen2.5-vl-3b-instruct-ft-10
models.description: A local version of Qwen2.5-VL-3B-Instruct with visual-language capabilities. Finetuned on 10%

models.name: custom/qwen2.5-vl-3b-instruct-ft-25
models.description: A local version of Qwen2.5-VL-3B-Instruct with visual-language capabilities. Finetuned on 25%

models.name: custom/qwen2.5-vl-3b-instruct-ft-50
models.description: A local version of Qwen2.5-VL-3B-Instruct with visual-language capabilities. Finetuned on 50%

models.name: custom/qwen2.5-vl-3b-instruct-ft-100
models.description: A local version of Qwen2.5-VL-3B-Instruct with visual-language capabilities. Finetuned on 100%
